snippet: A collector of recyclable goods got tired of shouting through a megaphone, so he asked his daughter to record a message for him. It’s now used by hundreds of merchants....
abstract: What in the World column; hundreds of scrap metal merchants across Mexico, in some other Latin American cities and even in United States, use advertising recording made in 2004 by Maria del Mar Terron Martinez, who was 10 years old at time; Martinez's father had his daughter make brief, looping recording after his own voice gave out from years of shouting into megaphone to advertise his scrap metal recycling business.
lead_paragraph: A collector of recyclable goods got tired of shouting through a megaphone, so he asked his daughter to record a message for him. It’s now used by hundreds of merchants.

headline.print_headline: A Young Girl’s Rolling Call for Scrap Metal
headline.main: Who’s That Voice Asking for Scrap Metal in Mexico? A 10-Year-Old Girl
